question: In adults with type 2 diabetes, does laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding produce higher remission rates than conventional (non-surgical) therapy? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Remission of type 2 diabetes was achieved by 22 (73%) in the surgical group and 4 (13%) in the conventional-therapy group.
content.source_2: In adjusted analyses, the probability of remission did not differ: the surgical arm showed a relative risk of 0.9 (95% confidence interval, 0.6â€“1.4) compared with conventional therapy.
content.source_3: CONCLUSIONS Participants randomized to surgical therapy were more likely to achieve remission of type 2 diabetes through greater weight loss.
content.source_4: At 24-month follow-up, conventional medical management yielded higher remission rates than laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding (29% vs 18%, intention-to-treat), even after controlling for baseline BMI and diabetes duration.
